message: No, without bootcamp. He need imac but Windows from windows programs. It is possible to install Windows directly?

message:

There is a whole bunch of guides if you Google it but the customer request is curiously odd. Personally I would just say sorry it's not something that I would do.

title: Imac 20 - Windows 7
message:
I've also got a bunch of customers who wants to run windows on their macs. I usually just use boot camp and keep the OSX partition relatively small and set it to boot from windows as the standard start disk. Then I always got the Mac OS available for trouble shooting when they have issues. They loose about 30GB hard drive capacity but that's the trade-off.

The 20-inch 2008-2009 iMacs only support 32 bit Windows 7.
